bibl.title: Town Quarters in Greek, Roman, Byzantine and Early Arab Egypt.

series.title: Islamic History and Civilization. Studies and Texts.

bibl.note: Overview of attestations of λαῦραι and ἄμφοδα in Greek papyri of the Ptolemaic, Roman and Byzantine periods (including lists, arranged by place). - Edition of P. Vindob. Graec. Inv. 31535 recto. List of λαῦραι + the beginnings of names (that is, toponyms), occasionally interspersed with the term ἐποίκιον + the beginnings of names or with other elements. Arsinoe, late-seventh / early-eighth century A.D. The other side, more difficult to read (part of a name, administrative term), brings into the world of early Arab Egypt.

bibl.title: Papyrology and the History of Early Islamic Egypt

bibl.seg: WORP Klaas A., Town Quarters in Greek, Roman, Byzantine and Early Arab Egypt.

Petra M. SIJPESTEIJN and Lennart SUNDELIN (Edd.), Papyrology and the History of Early Islamic Egypt = Islamic History and Civilization. Studies and Texts. 55 (Leiden, 2004) pp. 227-248; - 257-258, pll. 7-8.

Overview of attestations of λαῦραι and ἄμφοδα in Greek papyri of the Ptolemaic, Roman and Byzantine periods (including lists, arranged by place). - Edition of P. Vindob. Graec. Inv. 31535 recto. List of λαῦραι + the beginnings of names (that is, toponyms), occasionally interspersed with the term ἐποίκιον + the beginnings of names or with other elements. Arsinoe, late-seventh / early-eighth century A.D. The other side, more difficult to read (part of a name, administrative term), brings into the world of early Arab Egypt.
